text: "Stars" is a song by the Cranberries from the compilation album Stars: The Best of 1992-2002, and was released in October 2002.The Official Community of The Cranberries It is the band's last single released before their six-year hiatus.The Cranberries Biography – Biography.com The music video was directed by Jake Nava. ==Track listing== # "Stars" – 3:30 # "Dreaming My Dreams" – 3:37 # "Sunday" – 3:30 # "Hollywood" – 5:08 ==Personnel== *Dolores O'Riordan – lead vocals, guitars *Noel Hogan – lead guitars *Mike Hogan – bass guitar *Fergal Lawler – drums, percussion ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Chart (2002) !Peak position |- |- |Taiwan Singles ChartTop40-Charts.com. . Retrieved on 2012-02-05. |1 |- |- |} ==References== Category:The Cranberries songs Category:Music videos directed by Jake Nava Category:Songs written by Dolores O'Riordan Category:2002 singles Category:Song recordings produced by Stephen Street
title: Stars (The Cranberries song)
